thread.title: Telstra customers experience nationwide outage | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Telstra customers experience nationwide outage | Daily Mail Online

author: John Carney For Daily Mail Australia
title: Telstra customers experience nationwide outage | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share The telecommunications giant took to twitter to clarify that it is working to fix the services as soon as possible. 'A fire at one of our exchanges is impacting some mobile and fixed services. We're working to resolve ASAP. Thanks for your patience,' it Tweeted. Telstra tweeted that a fire at an exchange had caused the major disruption Soon mobile users were tweeting about an outage nation-wide But it was later reported that Telstra services were 'beginning to restore'. 'Our technicians are currently completing a full assessment of the impact. We will provide more information as soon as it is available,' Telstra said. However, they did not provided any further information on how widespread the outage is, but it appears to be affecting customers nation-wide. Social media users took to Twitter to express their displeasure in different parts of the country. Telstra clients have reportedly been advised that: 'Customers may experience difficulties making and receiving calls or using data via their mobile service'. The outage is the eighth to hit Telstra in 12 months. Last year's outages led to chief operating officer Kate McKenzie's resignation, and her replacement this year by Tesla board member Robyn Denholm. Mobile users in Tasmania, Victoria, NSW and Queensland have reported experiencing major problems (stock image) Share or comment on this article 84
